intro: Microstachys daphnoides var. oleoides, commonly known as the sweetleaf plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a small shrub characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves that are often aromatic. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, round fruits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its pleasant scent, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
